item.title: 花旗称特朗普关税豁免将减少对中国 GDP 的影响
item.description: 据花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：President Donald Trump’s latest tariff exemptions on consumer electronics and semiconductors could reduce the negative impact on China’s economy by 0.4 percentage points, if it were to last, according to Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 美国加征关税将导致贸易受阻，中国出口大幅增长
item.description: 中国 3 月份出口反弹，在美国本月对中国大规模加征关税之前为经济注入了活力。【原文：China’s exports rebounded in March, providing a boost to the economy ahead of the massive tariff hikes imposed against it by the US this month.】

item.title: 铜走高，关税缓和令交易商稍感宽慰
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对部分产品的惩罚性关税给予豁免后，铜与大多数其他金属一起走高，提振了整个金融市场的情绪。【原文：Copper edged higher with most other metals after President Donald Trump handed out exemptions to his punishing tariffs on some products, nudging up sentiment across financial markets.】

item.title: 交易商增加套期保值至五年新高，美元担忧加剧
item.description: 由于特朗普政府的关税政策有可能削弱美国的经济特殊性并损害美元，对冲美元潜在跌势的需求已跃升至五年来的最高点。【原文：Demand for hedging against potential dollar declines has jumped to a five-year high as the Trump administration’s tariff policy threatens to sap US economic exceptionalism and undermine the greenback.】

item.title: 中国的关税对策可能增加韩元和韩国债券的压力
item.description: 鉴于双边贸易和竞争压力巨大，如果中国因美国加征关税而大幅贬值韩元，韩国的韩元和债券可能会受到拖累。【原文：South Korea’s won and bonds may be dragged down if China significantly weakens its currency in response to US tariffs, given deep bilateral trade and competitive pressure.】

item.title: DHL 首席执行官称企业对关税混乱 "有点厌倦
item.description: DHL 集团首席执行官托比亚斯-迈耶（Tobias Meyer）表示，试图应对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统鞭长莫及的关税举措的公司和制造商正在产生疲劳感。【原文：Fatigue is setting in among companies and manufacturers trying to navigate President Donald Trump’s whipsawing tariff moves, according to DHL Group Chief Executive Officer Tobias Meyer.】

item.title: 贸易战令美元下挫，香港更接近于采取干预措施
item.description: 在中美贸易紧张局势肆虐导致美元暴跌之际，香港决策者正准备进行一次不同寻常的干预，以限制本地美元的涨幅。【原文：Hong Kong’s policymakers are getting close to stage an unusual intervention to cap the local dollar’s gains, as the greenback plummets due to raging trade tensions between US and China.】

item.title: 对冲基金和资产管理公司在关税影响下看涨日元
item.description: 对冲基金和资产经理对日元的乐观情绪正在蔓延，因为在交易员重新评估日本央行加息路径之际，美国关税推动了避险需求。【原文：Yen optimism is spreading among hedge funds and asset managers as US tariffs drive haven demand at a time when traders are reassessing the Bank of Japan’s interest rate hike path.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停部分关税，习近平寻求赢得东南亚的支持
item.description: 习近平主席今年的首次海外之行旨在展示中国在该地区的影响力。现在，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁将此行变成了阻止东南亚领导人以北京为代价达成交易的推动力。【原文：President Xi Jinping’s first overseas trip of the year was meant to showcase China’s clout in the region. Now, President Donald Trump’s tariff threats have turned it into a push to keep Southeast Asian leaders from cutting deals at Beijing’s expense.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德数十亿美元投资于中东私募股权投资复兴
item.description:
随着特朗普关税引发的市场动荡使美国交易复苏的希望破灭，该地区的吸引力进一步增强。【原文：

item.title: 关税缓和信号不一，亚洲科技股攀升
item.description: 在特朗普政府宣布暂停对手机、电脑和消费电子产品征收关税后，科技股上涨，尽管官员们后来淡化了这一缓和措施。【原文：Technology stocks rose after the Trump administration announced a pause in tariffs for phones, computers and consumer electronics, though officials later downplayed the reprieve.】

item.title: 高盛本月第二次下调中国股市目标价
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Strategists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. cut their targets for key Chinese stock indexes for a second time this month, citing heightened trade tensions with the US.】

item.title: 特朗普关税议程仍受关注，黄金从历史纪录下滑
item.description: 市场权衡了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的最新贸易消息后，黄金从创纪录水平回落。【原文：Gold edged down from a record as markets weighed the latest US trade news from President Donald Trump, who has driven a flight to safety assets amid mounting confusion over his tariff agenda.】

item.title: 新加坡放宽货币政策，预计 2025 年经济增长乏力
item.description: 新加坡央行进一步放宽了货币政策设定，因为今年的经济扩张步伐被认为会放缓，而且美国的关税给全球经济活动的前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Singapore’s central bank eased its monetary policy settings further as the economy is seen expanding at a weaker pace this year and US tariffs cloud the outlook for global activity.】

item.title: 英国急于寻找材料以维持英国钢铁厂运转
item.description: 英国官员正急于获得所需的原材料，以维持英国最后一家初级钢铁制造商的运转，其他企业也表示愿意提供帮助。【原文：UK officials are rushing to secure the raw materials needed to keep Britain’s last primary steel manufacturer running, with other businesses offering to provide help.】

item.title: 交易商消化简短的科技关税缓和，股票期货上涨
item.description: 由于投资者对特朗普政府就手机、电脑和流行消费电子产品互免关税问题的反反复复进行了分析，美国股指期货上涨。【原文：US stock futures gained as investors parsed the back-and-forth from the Trump administration on reciprocal tariff exemptions for phones, computers and popular consumer electronics.】

item.title: 普拉博沃改变政策后，全球基金暂停投资印尼
item.description: 印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）试图打造经济复兴，但却遭遇了一个硬道理：投资者对他推销的愿景并不买账。【原文：Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto’s attempt to engineer an economic renaissance is running up against a hard truth: Investors aren’t buying the vision he’s selling.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停科技关税后美国期货上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统暂停对一系列消费电子产品征收进口关税后，美国股票期货周一早盘上涨，但他表示将在适当时候宣布具体的关税措施。【原文：US equity futures rose early Monday after President Donald Trump paused import duties on a range of consumer electronics, though indicated a specific tariff will be announced in due course.】

item.title: 特朗普关税缓和及美伊谈判后石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 交易商权衡了华盛顿对智能手机和其他电子产品实行关税豁免的影响，以及美国和伊朗在周末进行的 "建设性 "讨论，石油价格下跌。【原文：Oil ticked lower as traders weighed the impact of Washington’s tariff exemptions for smartphones and other electronics and “constructive” weekend discussions between the US and Iran.】

item.title: 美国暂停征收电子产品关税后，日本股市期货攀升
item.description: 在美国暂停对部分消费电子产品征税后，日本的股票期货攀升，有报道称，这个亚洲国家正在为本周的关税谈判做准备。【原文：Japan’s stock futures climbed after the US paused levies on some consumer electronics and a report said the Asian nation is preparing for tariff negotiations this week.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停电子产品征税，美元暂时获得支撑
item.description: 在美国暂停对流行的消费电子产品征收关税后，美元从近期的颓势中略有回升，但由于唐纳德-特朗普总统淡化了对科技行业的豁免，美元的回升受到抑制。【原文：The dollar saw a modest reprieve from its recent rout after the US paused tariffs on popular consumer electronics, though the recovery was restrained by President Donald Trump downplaying his exemption for the technology sector.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 如今，不确定性似乎是大多数市场唯一的确定性，而在这种时刻，黄金出现了。由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策引发了对经济衰退的担忧，投资者继续涌向避风港。与此同时，欧洲去年的电动汽车充电站安装量居世界首位，今年春天上路的欧洲人将看到更多的电动汽车充电站。不过，美国驾驶员可以期待油价下降，但很可能不会达到去年的低点。【原文：Uncertainty seems to be the only certainty there is for most markets these days, and in those moments, there’s gold. Investors continue to rush to the safe haven as US President Donald Trump’s trade policies generate fears of recession. Meanwhile, Europeans hitting the road this spring will see many more electric-vehicle charging stations after the region led the world last year in installations. US drivers, though, can expect lower pump prices, but they’re likely to be farm from the lows that T】

item.title: AE 工业合作伙伴酝酿 20 亿美元约克空间销售
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，总部位于纽约的私募股权公司 AE Industrial Partners 正在考虑出售约克空间系统公司（York Space Systems），对这家卫星公司的估值可能超过 20 亿美元。【原文：AE Industrial Partners, a New York-based private equity firm, is considering a sale of York Space Systems that could value the satellite company at more than $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普表示正考虑对芯片和电子供应链征收关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普否认周五宣布的某些电子产品关税 "例外"，他在 Truth Social 上发表文章称，这些产品仍需缴纳现行的 20% 关税，政府正在研究对整个电子产品供应链征收关税。【原文：President Donald Trump denies that there was a tariff “exception” for certain electronics announced Friday, saying in a post on Truth Social that these products are still subject to existing tariffs of 20% and that the administration is looking into tariffs on the whole supply chain for electronics.】

item.title: 在关税风暴中，债券市场的陡峭化赌注被加足马力
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战不断升级，投资者纷纷逃离长期美国债券，国债市场上的一个常用赌注迎来了有史以来最好的走势之一。【原文：A go-to wager in the Treasury market is seeing one of its best runs ever as investors flee long-term US bonds amid President Donald Trump’s escalating trade war.】

item.title: 政变领导人承诺结束对石油的依赖，赢得加蓬大选
item.description: 加蓬军方领导人赢得了自两年前推翻政府以来的首次总统选举，从而巩固了自己的权力。【原文：Gabon’s military leader cemented his grip on power by winning the country’s first presidential election since he overthrew the government two years ago.】

item.title: 卡什卡利称美联储所能做的就是保持通胀稳定
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，相信在投资者理清唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统不断变化的贸易政策之际，市场将保持有序，并称央行必须继续专注于保持通胀预期。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari signaled confidence that markets will remain orderly as investors sort through President Donald Trump’s shifting trade policies and said the central bank must stay focused on keeping inflation expectations anchored.】

item.title: 特朗普能源部长称平均油价将下降
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯-赖特表示，本届美国政府的能源价格将低于上届政府。【原文：Energy prices are set to be lower under the current US administration than in the prior one, according to US Energy Secretary Chris Wright.】

item.title: 法国需要节约 400 亿欧元才能实现 2026 年赤字目标
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴（Eric Lombard）表示，法国需要再节省400亿欧元才能实现2026年的预算赤字目标。【原文：France will need to find a further €40 billion in savings to reach its 2026 budget deficit target, Finance Minister Eric Lombard said.】
